intro: Pedicularis rosea subsp. allionii, commonly known as the pink monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are ascending and can grow up to 60 cm in height. This species is typically found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
